intro: Chasmone crinita, commonly known as the silky chasmone, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and delicate, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it blooms during the summer months. Chasmone crinita is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
